definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer/fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions/ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
pinyin: cheng2 men2 shi1 huo3 , yang1 ji2 chi2 yu2

sentences.english: Luo city have door and the high-rise.
sentences.chinese: 例句與用法羅城的四面修有城門，上起高樓。

sentences.english: Ex-situ conservation has also been conducted. Some living specimens are planted in the Shing Mun Arboretum .
sentences.chinese: 漁護署已進行遷地保護，城門標本林內有栽培。

sentences.english: You know that angel in the gate custody fight is the most outrageous of?
sentences.chinese: 你們可知道，監護天使在城門口打架是最不像話的？

sentences.english: Faces appeared on the wall above the gate.
sentences.chinese: 城門上方的牆頭上出現了幾張臉。

sentences.english: One evening he came to the gate of a city and tried to enter.
sentences.chinese: 一天傍晚，他來到一座城門口想要進去。

sentences.english: Li Zhongzheng back and found the gates open, they hurriedly drove past view.
sentences.chinese: 李中正回城後發現城門大開，他們慌忙趕過去查看。

sentences.english: And he that talked with me had a golden reed to measure the city, and the gates thereof, and the wall thereof.
sentences.chinese: 對我說話的拿着金葦子當尺，要量那城，和城門城牆。

sentences.english: Abimelech and the companies with him rushed forward to a position at the entrance to the city gate.
sentences.chinese: 亞比米勒和跟隨他的一隊向前闖去，站在城門口。

sentences.english: Then the people of the LORD went down to the city gates.
sentences.chinese: 那時耶和華的民下到城門。

sentences.english: Then she went to an old cobbler near the gates of the town.
sentences.chinese: 然後她跑去找靠近鎮上城門口的一位老補鞋匠。

sentences.english: Tai Emperor of the Tang Dynasty named the city gate tower "Shangshan" mainly because of religious idea.
sentences.chinese: 宋太宗以“上善”爲城門賜名，主要出於宗教觀念。

sentences.english: I went back to the gate of Shiloh and there, I sawEli, dead.
sentences.chinese: 當我趕到夏洛城門的時候，我看見以利已經死了。

sentences.english: They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.
sentences.chinese: 坐在城門口的人對我議論紛紛，我成了酒徒之歌。

sentences.english: Then the king arose, and sat in the gate.
sentences.chinese: 於是王起來，坐在城門口。

sentences.english: And I commanded the Levites that they should cleanse themselves, and that they should come and keep the gates, to sanctify the sabbath day.
sentences.chinese: 我吩咐利未人潔淨自己，來守城門，使安息日爲聖。

sentences.english: Her husband is honourable in the gates, when he sitteth among the senators of the land.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫與當地長老同席，在城門口深爲衆人所認識。

definition: west/west side/western part/to the west of
Zhonglou district of Changzhou city 常州市[Chang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
bell tower/campanile/clock tower/Bell Tower, historic attraction in Xian, Beijing etc
variant of 這裡|这里[zhe4 li3]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
bend in a street/corner/to turn a corner
